channel.title: Safari 3 Beta (and Firefox 3)
channel.description:
[url=http://www.apple.com/safari/download/]Safari 3 Beta[/url]
This version is seemingly a lot better than the last version. It's for both PC's and Mac's. I think it's a great browser. It's significantly faster than Firefox for me. The only problem that I have with it is that the fonts are kinda ugly.
Might as well include Firefox 3 too, the newet version is [url=http://www.mozilla.com/en-US/firefox/all-beta.html]here[/url].

item.title: Safari 3 Beta (and Firefox 3)
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

The “real” FF3 is out now, it’s still in BETA but a lot of people seem to like it more than the last version.

Read full topic

item.title: Safari 3 Beta (and Firefox 3)
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:27, topic:152728”][quote author=sppt link=topic=208932.msg1860302#msg1860302 date=1193961835]
tried going to opera:config, then disabling it under the bittorrent section?
opera is still the best imo
[/quote]

I could have sworn I tried that and failed. :P[/quote]
Go to Tools-Preferences.

Go to downloads.

Make sure the button there with the text Hide File types open with opera.

Then Find Torrent in the list, Click Edit and change it to open with your own Torrent program.

Read full topic

item.title: Safari 3 Beta (and Firefox 3)
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:8, topic:152728”]Second, with my experience on an old MBP, Macs are generally faster than PC’s… Not to mention the fact that M$ is offering a downgrade to XP option for new PCs because Vista was such an epic fail.

Third, Leopard’s general requirements are 867-mhz processor, 512 mb RAM, DVD-drive, 9 GB free HDD space. Vista’s requirements without needing to disable features are 1 GHz processor, 1 GB RAM, DVD-drive, 15 GB free HDD space, as well as internet access. So I find it hard to believe Vista requires more resources, yet is ‘crisper’ and ‘faster,’ even when M$ is publicly admitting defeat, and XP is so much better.

Same. Also the fact that vista comes with a shiny cool 3d flip and you have to install extra software on the mac to do that.

So Vista comes with useless crap that is supposed to be one-upping Mac’s Expose? Mac’s come with a lot of features that you would have to pay extra on a PC for. iLife comes with Macs. iWork is $79, and is a much better deal than Office 07, which is what, $150 - $560?[/quote]

Exactly! Finally someone that realizes all that shiny flip crap that Vista comes with is wasting resources. I use XP and I’ll never go to Vista. So much of its resources are going into making it look “slick, and crisp” its just not worth it. If I want the “Vista look” that bad I’ll theme-patch my Xp then download one of the millions of Vista themes out there.

Read full topic

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:17, topic:152728”][quote author=RXVL link=topic=208932.msg1844495#msg1844495 date=1193373324]
Because people are afraid of change, that’s why. I used Opera for the longest time ever, then when I got my new PC it came with Firefox, and then I got hooked on it and now I can’t get used to Opera again.
[/quote]

But I mean he’s seriously considering Safari 3 Beta, why not consider Opera?[/quote]

I’ve tried Opera before, I didn’t particularly like it. It was a while ago so it may have changed a bit, I’ll download it and try it some time later (or tomorrow) probably. I’m trying Firefox 3 now, it’s pretty cool.

Read full topic

item.title: Safari 3 Beta (and Firefox 3)
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

Safari does this weird, pausing lag thing from time to time. When I open 4+ tabs it acts weird. I’ve also had it crash 2 or 3 times. The spell checker doesn’t work for me either (I don’t like correcting my own spelling errors).

It’s faster than Firefox but Firefox is definitely still more stable at the moment.

Read full topic

item.title: Safari 3 Beta (and Firefox 3)
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:5, topic:152728”]I know I’m probably the only one that notices, but have you ever noticed how slow the Mac interface is? Seriously, open up iTunes and drag the little corner thing to make it bigger. Notice the lag. Now open up any microsoft product and drag the corner thing. No window lag.

Same thing with every single button on a mac, those icky blue aqua things, it reminds me of Norton, just how slow they are to look like it registered your click, if at all. I don’t want my computer to look like a painting when I click stuff, nor do I want to have the interface slow.

This is one area where vista beats mac, vista’s interface is crisp, smooth and fast, and mac’s is chunky and slow.

(Why I won’t be using safari any time soon.)[/quote]

First of all, that’s a horrible example. iTunes was built for Mac, then rebuilt and redistributed as a PC version. Therein lies its ‘clunkiness.’ It’s analogous to trying Office for Mac, and concluding that Windows sucks. Even though it does.

Second, with my experience on an old MBP, Macs are generally faster than PC’s… Not to mention the fact that M$ is offering a downgrade to XP option for new PCs because Vista was such an epic fail.

Third, Leopard’s general requirements are 867-mhz processor, 512 mb RAM, DVD-drive, 9 GB free HDD space. Vista’s requirements without needing to disable features are 1 GHz processor, 1 GB RAM, DVD-drive, 15 GB free HDD space, as well as internet access. So I find it hard to believe Vista requires more resources, yet is ‘crisper’ and ‘faster,’ even when M$ is publicly admitting defeat, and XP is so much better.

lordslayer565:

Same. Also the fact that vista comes with a shiny cool 3d flip and you have to install extra software on the mac to do that.

So Vista comes with useless crap that is supposed to be one-upping Mac’s Expose? Mac’s come with a lot of features that you would have to pay extra on a PC for. iLife comes with Macs. iWork is $79, and is a much better deal than Office 07, which is what, $150 - $560?

io9:

Not in 10.5 Leopard, the new one; Finder becomes cover-flow style, which essentialy makes it closer to Vista.

Why exactly does this matter? Vista clearly ripped off Macs Spotlight, Widgets, and everything else. Why does it matter? Just compare which does it better, not who ripped what off whom. Especially when Mac was first.

Read full topic

This is one area where vista beats mac, vista’s interface is crisp, smooth and fast, and mac’s is chunky and slow.
[/quote]
Same. Also the fact that vista comes with a shiny cool 3d flip and you have to install extra software on the mac to do that.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Safari 3 Beta (and Firefox 3)
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

I know I’m probably the only one that notices, but have you ever noticed how slow the Mac interface is? Seriously, open up iTunes and drag the little corner thing to make it bigger. Notice the lag. Now open up any microsoft product and drag the corner thing. No window lag.

Same thing with every single button on a mac, those icky blue aqua things, it reminds me of Norton, just how slow they are to look like it registered your click, if at all. I don’t want my computer to look like a painting when I click stuff, nor do I want to have the interface slow.

This is one area where vista beats mac, vista’s interface is crisp, smooth and fast, and mac’s is chunky and slow.

(Why I won’t be using safari any time soon.)

Read full topic
